text: An Hallucinated Alchemist (), also known as The Alchemist's Hallucination, was an 1897 French short silent film directed by Georges Méliés. This film is lost. The videos online are not this film, but actually The Mysterious Retort (1906). == Plot == The film features a star with five female heads and a giant face that has people coming out of its mouth. == Production == The sets were hand painted. ==Release and influence== The film was released by Méliès's Star Film Company and is numbered 95 in its catalogues. The film is currently presumed lost. The 1900 Edison Manufacturing Company short The Clown and the Alchemist, directed by J. Stuart Blackton and Albert E. Smith, may have been inspired by this film. ==References== Category:1897 films Category:Films directed by Georges Méliès Category:Lost horror films Category:1890s horror films Category:French black-and-white films Category:Lost French films Category:French silent short films Category:French films Category:French horror films
title: An Hallucinated Alchemist
